programme.desc: Wildlife along the coast of Africa.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Contend with the challenges of the rainy season, which turns everything green and spoils the lions camouflage.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Madonna is the first Kinda baboon ever to be studied from birth to adulthood and now, critically, she is looking for a mate. Only recently identified as a species in their own right, Kinda baboons are little known and little understood.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Across Africa 97 black rhinos have been killed for their horns. In 1997 the species was declared officially extinct in Zambia, but now, thanks to an ambitious reintroduction plan, they are back.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Along the bank of the Luangwa River is a troop of eighty or so baboons. This is the story of a family, and a young male baboon who faces difficult choices as he comes of age.

programme.title: Orangutan Jungle School
programme.desc: Moving day arrives for the nursery school kids; Beni gets a beating from a bully; the socialization cage has a new queen; dominant male Pujon is still on a time-out after attacking Alba, but hes allowed a second chance to bond with his rival.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: Bonaires fringing reef is home to thousands of species of corals, fish and other marine animals. It is also home to a collection of stunning shipwrecks. These wrecks evolve over time, becoming artificial reefs.

programme.title: Reef Wrecks
programme.desc: The waters near the Florida Keys are home to as many as 1,000 shipwrecks.

programme.title: Wild Survivors
programme.desc: Zambias Luangwa Valley is a vast wilderness. It may seem ageless and permanent but in reality its in constant flux, influenced by the myriad of animals that call it home. Animals dont just live in a given environment, they help to shape it.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Surviving in the African savanna requires wit and guile. Especially for two of its hunters: African wild dogs and Dwarf mongooses.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: A complex web of relationships rules all life on earth, all species are interconnected, none can survive in isolation. While some relationships are one-sided, others are mutually beneficial.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: The Nile crocodile and Hippopotamus are two of Africas amphibious freshwater icons.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Feel the heat when the pride tries to hunt down adequate food as drought conditions push them (and their prey) dangerously close to death.

programme.title: Whale with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall explores the evolving understanding of whales, how much they have in common with humans, and how recent discoveries could help to better protect them from threats in an increasingly changing world.

programme.title: Whale with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve encounters the largest and most sophisticated hunters on the planet, revealing how the ingenious strategies used by whales can sometimes get these extraordinary predators in trouble.

programme.title: Dogs: An Amazing Animal Family
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the astonishing history and evolution of dogs and our pets weird, wild and wonderful relatives.

programme.title: Dogs: An Amazing Animal Family
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee heads to the Americas, home to tree-climbing canines, the hardy little Arctic fox and the majestic grey wolf.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: The effects of summer weather on Alaskan wildlife.

programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough brings the wonders of the Natural History Museums astonishing collection to life. During a magical, after-hours journey, he brings you closer than ever before to the extraordinary creatures that once roamed our planet.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Right beneath our feet is a secret world of disguise and espionage, social networking and courtship, rape and pillage, parenthood and relationships. Sir David Attenborough investigates how macroscopic residents outwit their enemies to survive.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Its a bug-eating world out there, and the documentary continues with a look at how the various critters disable the defences of their respective prey.

programme.desc: A businesswoman is in a whirlwind romance, but her newfound joy is cut short when her family finds her murdered; a bizarre confession reveals a deluded mind behind her death; in Northampton, England, a man with multiple stab wounds is discovered.

programme.desc: When a dog grows to be larger than expected, the dogs owners sue the pet store owner for a refund. When a young woman comes into a settlement, her friends father asks to borrow $3000.

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.sub-title: Eight Kids Is Enough!; Bleeding Puppy Neglect?!; Wheelchair-Bound Honeymoon Cruiser!

programme.sub-title: Bad Boy Fixation?!; Give Me Back My Fathers Ashes!

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: Patricks cherry tree launches an attack on Victors junipers, which prompts Victor to make a big mistake. Meanwhile, Victors interest in tropical fish arouses the interest of the local Greenpeace branch.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave

programme.desc: A sweltering summers night during a power cut proves to be a time for Victor and Margaret to reflect on their lives, hopes, and fears.

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs World of Steam, Steel and Stone

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Made in Britain

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a rail journey through Germany, steered by a Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide published in 1936. His unique window on Europe between the world wars takes him through a tumultuous period in German history, when the nations first democracy and its vibrant culture of art, design and decadence were swept away by fascism, nationalism and the increasing likelihood of war.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On an epic railway journey from Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh to Kolkata in West Bengal, Michael Portillo uses his Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, published when the British Raj was fifty-five years old, to chart a course through Indias history from the days of The East India Company to the dawn of independence.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Lifelong friends and skippers, Jimmy Buchan and Sandy Watt, take stock of the human cost of one of the most dangerous occupations known to mankind. As Jimmys trawler Amity lands a hefty catch of prawns, he comes to terms with his fears for the safety of his own life and those of his crew. Meanwhile, Sandys young apprentice John Duncan Campbell gets the chance hes been waiting for.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: A special insight into the struggles of fishermen who carry out the most dangerous job in Britain.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek rubs shoulders with pop music royalty when he picks up a classic Morgan sports car. A World War Two ambulance arrives at Thornton le Dale and a Ford Model T needs a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: This week at the Mathewsons, there is a 1982 Audi Quattro and a Sunbeam Alpine. Plus, Derek takes delivery of a beautiful green Renault van, previously used as a bread van in Paris.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will benefit from an owners decision that his broken vehicle is beyond repair, and secure a Mercedes 190 investment that they hope to restore.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: In the knife-edge world of hunters and hunted, mammals ability to learn new tricks is their key to survival. A killer whale is shown sneaking into a pool where elephant seal pups learn to swim, slow motion cameras reveal how the star-nosed mole can smell prey underwater, and young ibex demonstrate how to escape a fox by running up an almost vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An investigation of marine invertebrates and the way they thrive in the toughest parts of the ocean. Divers swim into a shoal of predatory Humboldt squid as the creatures emerge from the depths to hunt in packs, time-lapse photography reveals thousands of starfish gathering under the Arctic ice to devour a seal carcass, and a giant octopus protects her eggs by using her body to wall up a cave, starving to death in the process.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An incredible look at plants and their ingenious solutions to lifes challenges. Time-lapse photography reveals plants acting like fly-paper, or spring-loaded traps, to catch insects, while vines are shown developing suckers and claws to haul themselves up trees. Later the importance of shape for survival is illustrated by the dragons blood tree, which captures mist and shades its roots through its unusual form.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An amazing look at primates and their survival skills, from complex societies to tool use. Huge armies of Hamadryas baboons are seen battling on the plains of Ethiopia in order to steal females and settle old scores, Japanese macaques beat the cold by lounging in thermal springs - but only if they come from the right family, and an orang-utan baby fails in its struggle to make an umbrella out of leaves to keep off the rain.

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the Taurus Mountains Simon stays with descendants of the original Turks, nomads known as Yoruks, whose lifestyle is under threat from the amodern world and an increasingly Islamic government.
